intro: Rourea fulgens, commonly known as the golden rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy yellow bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. Rourea fulgens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
